Description: Fragment of flattened handle to sharpish turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine red-brown; cream slip. Rectangular stamp with herm symbol and seemingly extraneous flecks of clay.
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '36.'. Name Rhodon. From the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR P.16039, where the lower right is worn.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (237)
